page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY - CUSTOMS
page.content: {Tommy Loaves.}Steps Farm was owned by a wealthy family called Trotman in 1530. On St. Thomas day, December 21st Mr. Trotman distributed money and bread known as "Tommy Loaves" to the poor.{Dursley Festival.}Each June there are 2 or 3 weeks of sporting, musical and social gatherings. A Festival Queen and two attendants are chosen to preside over a carnival procession of "floats", stalls and displays. Place Names.{Cam}means "Crooked Stream".{Dursley}was named after a Saxon called Deorsige.{Ley}means clearing.{Crapen}means crows pen.{The {Broadwell}springs on which Dursley was founded.{The Quarry}the stone here was quarried by men who lived by the chapel.{Stinchcombe}means valley frequented by sandpiper or dunlin.
